abstract: The World Economic Forum will take place in Davos, Switzerland; the European Commission will publish its proposals on climate change policy; and Microsoft will release its earnings.
snippet: The World Economic Forum will take place in Davos, Switzerland; the European Commission will publish its proposals on climate change policy; and Microsoft will release its earnings.
lead_paragraph: GATHERING IN DAVOS The World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, will begin with a ceremony on Tuesday evening. World leaders scheduled to attend the forum include Shinzo Abe, prime minister of Japan; David Cameron, prime minister of Britain; Benjamin Netanyahu, prime minister of Israel; and Hassan Rouhani, president of Iran. The United States will be represented by Jacob J. Lew, the Treasury secretary; Penny Pritzker, secretary of commerce; and Gina McCarthy, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, who will discuss President Obama’s climate action plan. This year’s celebrity in residence is Matt Damon, who will receive an award for his charitable work. Some of the speeches and panels will be posted on the forum’s website, weforum.org.

headline.main: Economic Reports for the Week of Jan. 20
